intro: Lasiosiphon polyanthus, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks.
